title: As a first year MBBS student how should I prepare for my university exams in this COVID-19 pandemic? - Medical Doctors - Quora

response.answer_text: Try..to study from online sources… For anatomy u may refer the charsi of medical literature For phsiology ninja nerd ,Dr najeeb Regarding biochemistry it s memorising subjects so try to read it urself This TM we don't have any pressure for test or exams do we can study freely try to utilize this TM. And u may also revise what u have studied in the cllg before lockdown as it will help u in university exam When our exams will v taken is not sure when our cllgs will open it is also not confirm but one thing confirm is we are going to b a Dr so keep studying

Your best bet when you are short on time is doing question answers. You will both get an idea of important questions and be ready to tackle almost any exam question. We used Ayush Agarwal as the question book here. I personally did question answers for all subjects in my first year in the last month and managed to secure 70% in profs (finals) though i only secured 40% in sentups (pre finals).

Firstly u should solve questions of last 10 yrs …n write ol questions and answers on copy same as it is write in exams..revised daily..revision is must ..n also preparing by flow chart and diagram it' helps u in gaining marks .read n read n read ..there is no shortcut .. N one thing u can also do that if u facing any prb in any topic u should watch the video this helps u in understanding the sub.
